com.github.nfcforandroid.api
Interface INfaManager

public interface INfaManager

Author:
jefBinomed Main interface that drives the interactions between your Activity and the nfc android features. Two implementations are write in the nfa-core module.

pause

void pause(android.app.Activity activity)
You should call this method when the activity enter in Activity.onPause(). This call is mandatory because it's the guaranty of the unregistration of your application against the NfcAdapter

Parameters:
activity - the activity you will unregister

resume

void resume(android.app.Activity activity)
You should call this method when the activity enter in Activity.onResume(). This call is mandatory because it's the guaranty of the registration of your application against the NfcAdapter During this call, all the filters you have previously define will be add to the NfcAdapter

Parameters:
activity - the activity you will register

stop

void stop(android.app.Activity activity)
You should call this method when the activity enter in Activity.onStop(). This call is mandatory because it's the guaranty of the clean of all your filters

Parameters:
activity - the activity you will clean

manageIntent

<Record extends INfaRecord> void manageIntent(NfaRecieveBean<Record> recieveConfiguration)
This method is to call when a tag or message is detect by the android framework. You will call this method in the Activity#onNewIntent() method or during the first creation of your activity to process the first Intent. This method will process the tag to convert it into something more readable / treatable according to your NfaRecieveBean configuration

Parameters:
recieveConfiguration - the configuration to use to convert the enter tag message

writeTag

<Record extends INfaRecord> void writeTag(android.content.Context context,
                                          android.content.Intent intent,
                                          INfaIntentWrite recieve,
                                          boolean addAndroidApplicationRecord,
                                          NfaWriteBean<Record>... writers)
This method is to call when you want to write some datas on a tag. You will call this method in the Activity#onNewIntent() method This method will convert your data to an NdefMessage and write it on the detect tag

Parameters:
context - the curent Context. Could not be null.
intent - the intent at the origin of the call (You have to use the intent of onNewIntent because it contains the mandatory information to identify the tag). Could not be null.
recieve - the callBack interface. could not be null.
addAndroidApplicationRecord - true if you want to integrate an AndroidApplicationRecord. false else.
writers - a collection of bean configuration to write the datas you need. You should have at least one NfaWriteBean !
